member.name: T:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicLinqTypeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates to Dynamic Linq to consider the Type as a valid dynamic linq type. Use only when .CustomTypeProvider is set to .

member.name: T:System.Linq.Dynamic.DefaultDynamicLinqCustomTypeProvider
member.summary: The default . Scans the current for all types marked with , and adds them as custom Dynamic Link types.

member.name: T:System.Linq.Dynamic.IDynamicLinkCustomTypeProvider
member.summary: Interface for providing custom types for Dynamic Linq.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.IDynamicLinkCustomTypeProvider.GetCustomTypes
member.summary: Returns a list of custom types that Dynamic Linq will understand.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DefaultDynamicLinqCustomTypeProvider.GetCustomTypes
member.summary: Returns a list of custom types that Dynamic Linq will understand.

member.name: T:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable
member.summary: Provides a set of static (Shared in Visual Basic) methods for querying data structures that implement . It allows dynamic string based querying. Very handy when, at compile time, you don't know the type of queries that will be generated, or when downstream components only return column names to sort and filter by.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable.Where``1(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Filters a sequence of values based on a predicate.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of source.
member.param: A to filter.
An expression string to test each element for a condition.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similiar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.returns: A that contains elements from the input sequence that satisfy the condition specified by predicate.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable.Where(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Filters a sequence of values based on a predicate.
member.param: A to filter.
An expression string to test each element for a condition.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similiar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.returns: A that contains elements from the input sequence that satisfy the condition specified by predicate.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable.Select(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Projects each element of a sequence into a new form.
member.param: A sequence of values to project.
A projection string expression to apply to each element.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similiar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.returns: An whose elements are the result of invoking a projection string on each element of source.

example.code: var singleField = qry.Select("StringProperty"); var dynamicObject = qry.Select("new (StringProperty1, StringProperty2 as OtherStringPropertyName)");

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable.SelectMany(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Projects each element of a sequence to an and combines the resulting sequences into one sequence.
member.param: A sequence of values to project.
A projection string expression to apply to each element.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similiar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.returns: An whose elements are the result of invoking a one-to-many projection function on each element of the input sequence.

member.returns: A whose elements are sorted according to the specified .

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable.GroupBy(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Groups the elements of a sequence according to a specified key string function and creates a result value from each group and its key.
member.param: A whose elements to group.
A string expression to specify the key for each element.
A string expression to specify a result value from each group.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similiar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.returns: A where each element represents a projection over a group and its key.

example.code: var groupResult1 = qry.GroupBy("NumberPropertyAsKey", "StringProperty"); var groupResult2 = qry.GroupBy("new (NumberPropertyAsKey, StringPropertyAsKey)", "new (StringProperty1, StringProperty2)");

A string expression to specify the key for each element.
A string expression to specify a result value from each group.
member.returns: A where each element represents a projection over a group and its key.

example.code: var groupResult1 = qry.GroupBy("NumberPropertyAsKey", "StringProperty"); var groupResult2 = qry.GroupBy("new (NumberPropertyAsKey, StringPropertyAsKey)", "new (StringProperty1, StringProperty2)");

example.code: var groupResult1 = qry.GroupBy("NumberPropertyAsKey"); var groupResult2 = qry.GroupBy("new (NumberPropertyAsKey, StringPropertyAsKey)");

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable.GroupByMany``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.String[])
member.summary: Groups the elements of a sequence according to multiple specified key string functions and creates a result value from each group (and subgroups) and its key.
member.param: A whose elements to group.
expressions to specify the keys for each element.
member.returns: A of type where each element represents a projection over a group, its key, and its subgroups.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable.GroupByMany``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Object}[])
member.summary: Groups the elements of a sequence according to multiple specified key functions and creates a result value from each group (and subgroups) and its key.
member.param: A whose elements to group.
Lambda expressions to specify the keys for each element.
member.returns: A of type where each element represents a projection over a group, its key, and its subgroups.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable.Join(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Correlates the elements of two sequences based on matching keys. The default equality comparer is used to compare keys.
member.param: The first sequence to join.
The sequence to join to the first sequence.
A dynamic function to extract the join key from each element of the first sequence.
A dynamic function to extract the join key from each element of the second sequence.
A dynamic function to create a result element from two matching elements.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicates as parameters. Similiar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.returns: An obtained by performing an inner join on two sequences.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable.Join``1(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Correlates the elements of two sequences based on matching keys. The default equality comparer is used to compare keys.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements of both sequences, and the result.
member.param: The first sequence to join.
The sequence to join to the first sequence.
A dynamic function to extract the join key from each element of the first sequence.
A dynamic function to extract the join key from each element of the second sequence.
A dynamic function to create a result element from two matching elements.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicates as parameters. Similiar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.remarks: This overload only works on elements where both sequences and the resulting element match.
member.returns: An that has elements of type TResult obtained by performing an inner join on two sequences.

member.name: P:System.Linq.Dynamic.GlobalConfig.AreContextKeywordsEnabled
member.summary: Determines if the context keywords (it, parent, and root) are valid and usable inside a Dynamic Linq string expression. Does not affect the usability of the equivalent context symbols ($, ^ and ~).

member.name: T:System.Linq.Dynamic.BasicQueryable
member.summary: Provides a set of static (Shared in Visual Basic) methods for querying data structures that implement . It adds basic methods to that would normally require .

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.BasicQueryable.Take(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a specified number of contiguous elements from the start of a sequence.
member.param: The sequence to return elements from.
The number of elements to return.
member.returns: A that contains the specified number of elements from the start of source.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.BasicQueryable.Skip(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Int32)
member.summary: Bypasses a specified number of elements in a sequence and then returns the remaining elements.
member.param: A to return elements from.
The number of elements to skip before returning the remaining elements.
member.returns: A that contains elements that occur after the specified index in the input sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.BasicQueryable.Reverse(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Inverts the order of the elements in a sequence.
member.param: A sequence of values to reverse.
member.returns: A whose elements correspond to those of the input sequence in reverse order.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.BasicQueryable.Any(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Determines whether a sequence contains any elements.
member.param: A sequence to check for being empty.
member.returns: true if the source sequence contains any elements; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.BasicQueryable.Count(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Returns the number of elements in a sequence.
member.param: The that contains the elements to be counted.
member.returns: The number of elements in the input sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.BasicQueryable.Sum(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Computes the sum of a sequence of numeric values.
member.param: A sequence of numeric values to calculate the sum of.
member.returns: The sum of the values in the sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.BasicQueryable.Single(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Returns the only element of a sequence, and throws an exception if there is not exactly one element in the sequence.
member.param: A to return the single element of.
member.returns: The single element of the input sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.BasicQueryable.SingleOrDefault(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Returns the only element of a sequence, or a default value if the sequence is empty; this method throws an exception if there is more than one element in the sequence.
member.param: A to return the single element of.
member.returns: The single element of the input sequence, or default(TSource) if the sequence contains no elements.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.BasicQueryable.First(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Returns the first element of a sequence.
member.param: The to return the first element of.
member.returns: The first element in source.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.BasicQueryable.FirstOrDefault(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Returns the first element of a sequence, or a default value if the sequence contains no elements.
member.param: The to return the first element of.
member.returns: default(TSource) if source is empty; otherwise, the first element in source.

member.summary: Returns the last element of a sequence.
member.param: The to return the last element of.
member.returns: The last element in source.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.BasicQueryable.LastOrDefault(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Returns the last element of a sequence, or a default value if the sequence contains no elements.
member.param: The to return the last element of.
member.returns: default(TSource) if source is empty; otherwise, the last element in source.

member.summary: Returns the input typed as of dynamic.
